delegates.help: When false, WorkloadClassifiers in the target database that are not defined in the source will be dropped during deployment.

delegates.name: DoNotEvaluateSqlCmdVariables
delegates.help: Specifies whether SQLCMD variables to not replace with values

delegates.name: DropConstraintsNotInSource
delegates.help: Specifies whether constraints that do not exist in the database snapshot (.dacpac) file will be dropped from the target database when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: DropDmlTriggersNotInSource
delegates.help: Specifies whether DML triggers that do not exist in the database snapshot (.dacpac) file will be dropped from the target database when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: DropExtendedPropertiesNotInSource
delegates.help: Specifies whether extended properties that do not exist in the database snapshot (.dacpac) file will be dropped from the target database when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: DropIndexesNotInSource
delegates.help: Specifies whether indexes that do not exist in the database snapshot (.dacpac) file will be dropped from the target database when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: DropObjectsNotInSource
delegates.help: Specifies whether objects that do not exist in the database snapshot (.dacpac) file will be dropped from the target database when you publish to a database. This value takes precedence over DropExtendedProperties.

delegates.name: DropPermissionsNotInSource
delegates.help: Specifies whether permissions that do not exist in the database snapshot (.dacpac) file will be dropped from the target database when you publish updates to a database.

delegates.name: DropRoleMembersNotInSource
delegates.help: Specifies whether role members that are not defined in the database snapshot (.dacpac) file will be dropped from the target database when you publish updates to a database.

delegates.name: DropStatisticsNotInSource
delegates.help: Specifies whether statistics that do not exist in the database snapshot (.dacpac) file will be dropped from the target database when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: EnclaveAttestationProtocol
delegates.help: Specifies an attestation protocol to be used with enclave based Always Encrypted.

delegates.name: EnclaveAttestationUrl
delegates.help: Specifies the enclave attestation URL (an attestation service endpoint) to be used with enclave based Always Encrypted.

delegates.name: ExcludeObjectType
delegates.help: An object type that should be ignored during deployment. Valid object type names are Aggregates, ApplicationRoles, Assemblies, AssemblyFiles, AsymmetricKeys, BrokerPriorities, Certificates, ColumnEncryptionKeys, ColumnMasterKeys, Contracts, DatabaseOptions, DatabaseRoles, DatabaseTriggers, Defaults, ExtendedProperties, ExternalDataSources, ExternalFileFormats, ExternalTables, Filegroups, Files, FileTables, FullTextCatalogs, FullTextStoplists, MessageTypes, PartitionFunctions, PartitionSchemes, Permissions, Queues, RemoteServiceBindings, RoleMembership, Rules, ScalarValuedFunctions, SearchPropertyLists, SecurityPolicies, Sequences, Services, Signatures, StoredProcedures, SymmetricKeys, Synonyms, Tables, TableValuedFunctions, UserDefinedDataTypes, UserDefinedTableTypes, ClrUserDefinedTypes, Users, Views, XmlSchemaCollections, Audits, Credentials, CryptographicProviders, DatabaseAuditSpecifications, DatabaseEncryptionKeys, DatabaseScopedCredentials, Endpoints, ErrorMessages, EventNotifications, EventSessions, LinkedServerLogins, LinkedServers, Logins, MasterKeys, Routes, ServerAuditSpecifications, ServerRoleMembership, ServerRoles, ServerTriggers, ExternalStreams, ExternalStreamingJobs, DatabaseWorkloadGroups, WorkloadClassifiers, ExternalLibraries, ExternalLanguages.

delegates.name: ExcludeObjectTypes
delegates.help: A semicolon-delimited list of object types that should be ignored during deployment. Valid object type names are Aggregates, ApplicationRoles, Assemblies, AssemblyFiles, AsymmetricKeys, BrokerPriorities, Certificates, ColumnEncryptionKeys, ColumnMasterKeys, Contracts, DatabaseOptions, DatabaseRoles, DatabaseTriggers, Defaults, ExtendedProperties, ExternalDataSources, ExternalFileFormats, ExternalTables, Filegroups, Files, FileTables, FullTextCatalogs, FullTextStoplists, MessageTypes, PartitionFunctions, PartitionSchemes, Permissions, Queues, RemoteServiceBindings, RoleMembership, Rules, ScalarValuedFunctions, SearchPropertyLists, SecurityPolicies, Sequences, Services, Signatures, StoredProcedures, SymmetricKeys, Synonyms, Tables, TableValuedFunctions, UserDefinedDataTypes, UserDefinedTableTypes, ClrUserDefinedTypes, Users, Views, XmlSchemaCollections, Audits, Credentials, CryptographicProviders, DatabaseAuditSpecifications, DatabaseEncryptionKeys, DatabaseScopedCredentials, Endpoints, ErrorMessages, EventNotifications, EventSessions, LinkedServerLogins, LinkedServers, Logins, MasterKeys, Routes, ServerAuditSpecifications, ServerRoleMembership, ServerRoles, ServerTriggers, ExternalStreams, ExternalStreamingJobs, DatabaseWorkloadGroups, WorkloadClassifiers, ExternalLibraries, ExternalLanguages.

delegates.name: GenerateSmartDefaults
delegates.help: Automatically provides a default value when updating a table that contains data with a column that does not allow null values.

delegates.name: HashObjectNamesInLogs
delegates.help: Specifies whether to replace all object names in logs with a random hash value.

delegates.name: IgnoreAnsiNulls
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the ANSI NULLS setting should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreAuthorizer
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the Authorizer should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreColumnCollation
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the column collations should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreColumnOrder
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in table column order should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreComments
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the comments should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreCryptographicProviderFilePath
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the file path for the cryptographic provider should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreDatabaseWorkloadGroups
delegates.help: Specifies whether to exclude workload groups that exist on the target during deployment.  No Database Workload Groups will be added, modified, or dropped.

delegates.name: IgnoreDdlTriggerOrder
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the order of Data Definition Language (DDL) triggers should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database or server.

delegates.name: IgnoreDdlTriggerState
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the enabled or disabled state of Data Definition Language (DDL) triggers should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreDefaultSchema
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the default schema should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreDmlTriggerOrder
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the order of Data Manipulation Language (DML) triggers should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreDmlTriggerState
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the enabled or disabled state of DML triggers should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreExtendedProperties
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the extended properties should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreFileAndLogFilePath
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the paths for files and log files should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreFilegroupPlacement
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the placement of objects in FILEGROUPs should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreFileSize
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the file sizes should be ignored or whether a warning should be issued when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreFillFactor
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the fill factor for index storage should be ignored or whether a warning should be issued when you publish.

delegates.name: IgnoreFullTextCatalogFilePath
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the file path for the full-text be ignored or whether a warning should be issued when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreIdentitySeed
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the seed for an identity column should be ignored or updated when you publish updates to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreIncrement
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the increment for an identity column should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreIndexOptions
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the index options should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreIndexPadding
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the index padding should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreKeywordCasing
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the casing of keywords should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreLockHintsOnIndexes
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the lock hints on indexes should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreLoginSids
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the security identification number (SID) should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreNotForReplication
delegates.help: Specifies whether the not for replication settings should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreObjectPlacementOnPartitionScheme
delegates.help: Specifies whether an object's placement on a partition scheme should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnorePartitionSchemes
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in partition schemes and functions should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnorePermissions
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the permissions should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreQuotedIdentifiers
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the quoted identifiers setting should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreRoleMembership
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the role membership of logins should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreRouteLifetime
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the amount of time that SQL Server retains the route in the routing table should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreSemicolonBetweenStatements
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the semi-colons between T-SQL statements will be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreSensitivityClassifications
delegates.help: Specifies whether data sensitivity classifications on columns should be ignored when comparing schema models. This only works for classifications added with the ADD SENSITIVITY CLASSIFICATION syntax introduced in SQL 2019.

delegates.name: IgnoreTableOptions
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the table options will be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreTablePartitionOptions
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the table partition options will be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.  This option applies only to Azure Synapse Analytics data warehouse databases.

delegates.name: IgnoreUserSettingsObjects
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the user settings objects will be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreWhitespace
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in white space will be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreWithNocheckOnCheckConstraints
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the value of the WITH NOCHECK clause for check constraints will be ignored or updated when you publish.

delegates.name: IgnoreWithNocheckOnForeignKeys
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the value of the WITH NOCHECK clause for foreign keys will be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IgnoreWorkloadClassifiers
delegates.help: Specifies whether to exclude workload classifiers that exist on the target during deployment.

delegates.name: IncludeCompositeObjects
delegates.help: Include all composite elements with the same database as part of a single publish operation.

delegates.name: IncludeTransactionalScripts
delegates.help: Specifies whether transactional statements should be used where possible when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: IsAlwaysEncryptedParameterizationEnabled
delegates.help: Enables variable parameterization on Always Encrypted columns in pre/post deployment scripts.

delegates.name: LongRunningCommandTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the long running command timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQL Server. Use 0 to wait indefinitely.

delegates.name: NoAlterStatementsToChangeClrTypes
delegates.help: Specifies that publish should always drop and re-create an assembly if there is a difference instead of issuing an ALTER ASSEMBLY statement.

delegates.name: PopulateFilesOnFileGroups
delegates.help: Specifies whether a new file is also created when a new FileGroup is created in the target database.

delegates.name: PreserveIdentityLastValues
delegates.help: Specifies whether last values for identity columns should be preserved during deployment.

delegates.name: RegisterDataTierApplication
delegates.help: Specifies whether the schema is registered with the database server.

delegates.name: RestoreSequenceCurrentValue
delegates.help: Specifies whether sequence object current value should be deployed with dacpac file, the default value is True.

delegates.name: RunDeploymentPlanExecutors
delegates.help: Specifies whether DeploymentPlanExecutor contributors should be run when other operations are executed.

delegates.name: ScriptDatabaseCollation
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the database collation should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: ScriptDatabaseCompatibility
delegates.help: Specifies whether differences in the database compatibility should be ignored or updated when you publish to a database.

delegates.name: ScriptDatabaseOptions
delegates.help: Specifies whether target database properties should be set or updated as part of the publish action.

delegates.name: ScriptDeployStateChecks
delegates.help: Specifies whether statements are generated in the publish script to verify that the database name and server name match the names specified in the database project.

delegates.name: ScriptFileSize
delegates.help: Controls whether size is specified when adding a file to a filegroup.

delegates.name: ScriptNewConstraintValidation
delegates.help: At the end of publish all of the constraints will be verified as one set, avoiding data errors caused by a check or foreign key constraint in the middle of publish. If set to False, your constraints are published without checking the corresponding data.

delegates.name: ScriptRefreshModule
delegates.help: Include refresh statements at the end of the publish script.

delegates.name: Storage
delegates.help: Specifies how elements are stored when building the database model. For performance reasons the default is InMemory. For large databases, File backed storage may be required and is only available for .NET Framework version of SqlPackage.

delegates.name: TreatVerificationErrorsAsWarnings
delegates.help: Specifies whether errors encountered during publish verification should be treated as warnings. The check is performed against the generated deployment plan before the plan is executed against your target database. Plan verification detects problems such as the loss of target-only objects (such as indexes) that must be dropped to make a change. Verification will also detect situations where dependencies (such as a table or view) exist because of a reference to a composite project, but do not exist in the target database. You might choose to do this to get a complete list of all issues, instead of having the publish action stop on the first error.

delegates.name: UnmodifiableObjectWarnings
delegates.help: Specifies whether warnings should be generated when differences are found in objects that cannot be modified, for example, if the file size or file paths were different for a file.

delegates.name: VerifyCollationCompatibility
delegates.help: Specifies whether collation compatibility is verified.

delegates.name: VerifyDeployment
delegates.help: Specifies whether checks should be performed before publishing that will stop the publish action if issues are present that might block successful publishing. For example, your publish action might stop if you have foreign keys on the target database that do not exist in the database project, and that causes errors when you publish.

properties.name: Quiet
properties.help: Specifies whether detailed feedback is suppressed. Defaults to False.

properties.name: ReferencePaths
properties.help: Specifies the additional directories to search for .dacpac references.

properties.name: SourceFile
properties.help: Specifies a source file to be used as the source of action. If this parameter is used, no other source parameter shall be valid.

properties.name: SourceConnectionString
properties.help: Specifies a valid [SQL Server/Azure connection string](/dotnet/api/microsoft.data.sqlclient.sqlconnection.connectionstring) to the source database. If this parameter is specified, it shall be used exclusively of all other source parameters.

properties.name: SourceDatabaseName
properties.help: Defines the name of the source database.

properties.name: SourceEncryptConnection
properties.help: Specifies if SQL encryption should be used for the source database connection. Default value is True.

properties.name: SourceHostNameInCertificate
properties.help: Specifies value that is used to validate the source SQL Server TLS/SSL certificate when the communication layer is encrypted by using TLS.

properties.name: SourcePassword
properties.help: For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the password to use to access the source database.

properties.name: SourceServerName
properties.help: Defines the name of the server hosting the source database.

properties.name: SourceTimeout
properties.help: Specifies the timeout for establishing a connection to the source database in seconds.

properties.name: SourceTrustServerCertificate
properties.help: Specifies whether to use TLS to encrypt the source database connection and bypass walking the certificate chain to validate trust. Default value is False.

properties.name: SourceUser
properties.help: For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the SQL Server user to use to access the source database.

properties.name: TargetFile
properties.help: Specifies a target file (that is, a .dacpac file) to be used as the target of action instead of a database. If this parameter is used, no other target parameter shall be valid. This parameter shall be invalid for actions that only support database targets.

properties.name: TargetConnectionString
properties.help: Specifies a valid [SQL Server/Azure connection string](/dotnet/api/microsoft.data.sqlclient.sqlconnection.connectionstring) to the target database. If this parameter is specified, it shall be used exclusively of all other target parameters.

properties.name: TargetDatabaseName
properties.help: Specifies an override for the name of the database that is the target of SqlPackage Action.

properties.name: TargetEncryptConnection
properties.help: Specifies if SQL encryption should be used for the target database connection. Default value is True.

properties.name: TargetHostNameInCertificate
properties.help: Specifies value that is used to validate the target SQL Server TLS/SSL certificate when the communication layer is encrypted by using TLS.

properties.name: TargetPassword
properties.help: For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the password to use to access the target database.

properties.name: TargetServerName
properties.help: Defines the name of the server hosting the target database.

properties.name: TargetTimeout
properties.help: Specifies the timeout for establishing a connection to the target database in seconds. For Azure AD, it is recommended that this value be greater than or equal to 30 seconds.

properties.name: TargetTrustServerCertificate
properties.help: Specifies whether to use TLS to encrypt the target database connection and bypass walking the certificate chain to validate trust. Default value is False.

properties.name: TargetUser
properties.help: For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the SQL Server user to use to access the target database.

properties.name: TenantId
properties.help:
Represents the Azure AD tenant ID or domain name. This option is required to support guest or imported Azure AD users as well as Microsoft accounts such as outlook.com, hotmail.com, or live.com. If this parameter is omitted, the default tenant ID for Azure AD will be used, assuming that the authenticated user is a native user for this AD. However, in this case any guest or imported users and/or Microsoft accounts hosted in this Azure AD are not supported and the operation will fail.
For more information about Active Directory Universal Authentication, see [Universal Authentication with SQL Database and Azure Synapse Analytics (SSMS support for MFA)](/azure/sql-database/sql-database-ssms-mfa-authentication).

properties.name: ThreadMaxStackSize
properties.help: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes for the thread running the SqlPackage action. This option should only be used when encountering stack overflow exceptions that occur when parsing very large TSQL statements.

properties.name: UniversalAuthentication
properties.help:
Specifies if Universal Authentication should be used. When set to True, the interactive authentication protocol is activated supporting MFA. This option can also be used for Azure AD authentication without MFA, using an interactive protocol requiring the user to enter their username and password or integrated authentication (Windows credentials). When /UniversalAuthentication is set to True, no Azure AD authentication can be specified in SourceConnectionString (/scs). When /UniversalAuthentication is set to False, Azure AD authentication must be specified in SourceConnectionString (/scs).
For more information about Active Directory Universal Authentication, see [Universal Authentication with SQL Database and Azure Synapse Analytics (SSMS support for MFA)](/azure/sql-database/sql-database-ssms-mfa-authentication).

properties.name: Variables
properties.help: Specifies a name value pair for an action-specific variable;{VariableName}={Value}. The DACPAC file contains the list of valid SQLCMD variables. An error results if a value is not provided for every variable.

tasks.help: The SqlPackage Import action imports the schema and table data from a BACPAC file (.bacpac) into a new or empty database in SQL Server or Azure SQL Database. At the time of the import operation to an existing database the target database cannot contain any user-defined schema objects. Alternatively, a new database can be created by the import action when the authenticated user has create database permissions.

properties.name: AccessToken
properties.help: Specifies the token-based authentication access token to use when connect to the target database.

properties.name: AzureCloudConfig
properties.help: Specifies the custom endpoints for connecting to Azure Active Directory in the format: AzureActiveDirectoryAuthority={value};DatabaseServicePrincipalName={value}" .

properties.name: Diagnostics
properties.help: Specifies whether diagnostic logging is output to the console. Defaults to False.

properties.name: DiagnosticsFile
properties.help: Specifies a file to store diagnostic logs.

properties.name: MaxParallelism
properties.help: Specifies the degree of parallelism for concurrent operations running against a database. The default value is 8.

properties.name: ModelFilePath
properties.help: Specifies the file path to override the model.xml in the source file. Use of this setting may result in deployment failure and/or unintended data loss. This setting is intended only for use when troubleshooting issues with publish, import, or script generation.

properties.name: Properties
properties.help: Specifies a name value pair for an [action-specific property](#properties-specific-to-the-import-action); {PropertyName}={Value}.

delegates.name: CommandTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the command timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQL Server.

delegates.name: DatabaseEdition
delegates.help: Defines the edition of an Azure SQL Database. See [Azure SQL Database service tiers](/azure/azure-sql/database/service-tiers-general-purpose-business-critical).

delegates.name: DatabaseLockTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the database lock timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQLServer. Use -1 to wait indefinitely.

delegates.name: DatabaseMaximumSize
delegates.help: Defines the maximum size in GB of an Azure SQL Database.

delegates.name: DatabaseServiceObjective
delegates.help: Defines the performance level of an Azure SQL Database such as "P0" or "S1".

delegates.name: DisableIndexesForDataPhase
delegates.help: When true (default), disables indexes before importing data. When false, indexes are not rebuilt.

delegates.name: DisableParallelismForEnablingIndexes
delegates.help: Not using parallelism when rebuilding indexes while importing data into SQL Server.

delegates.name: HashObjectNamesInLogs
delegates.help: Specifies whether to replace all object names in logs with a random hash value.

delegates.name: ImportContributorArguments
delegates.help: Specifies deployment contributor arguments for the deployment contributors. This property should be a semi-colon delimited list of values.

delegates.name: ImportContributorPaths
delegates.help: Specifies paths to load additional import contributors. This property should be a semi-colon delimited list of values.

delegates.name: ImportContributors
delegates.help: Specifies the deployment contributors, which should run when the bacpac is imported. This property should be a semi-colon delimited list of fully qualified build contributor names or IDs.

delegates.name: LongRunningCommandTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the long running command timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQL Server. Use 0 to wait indefinitely.

delegates.name: PreserveIdentityLastValues
delegates.help: Specifies whether last values for identity columns should be preserved during deployment.

delegates.name: RebuildIndexesOfflineForDataPhase
delegates.help: When true, rebuilds indexes offline after importing data into SQL Server.

delegates.name: Storage
delegates.help: Specifies how elements are stored when building the database model. For performance reasons the default is InMemory. For large databases, File backed storage is required.

properties.name: Quiet
properties.help: Specifies whether detailed feedback is suppressed. Defaults to False.

properties.name: SourceFile
properties.help: Specifies a source file to be used as the source of action from local storage. If this parameter is used, no other source parameter shall be valid.

properties.name: TargetConnectionString
properties.help: Specifies a valid [SQL Server/Azure connection string](/dotnet/api/microsoft.data.sqlclient.sqlconnection.connectionstring) to the target database. If this parameter is specified, it shall be used exclusively of all other target parameters.

properties.name: TargetDatabaseName
properties.help: Specifies an override for the name of the database that is the target of SqlPackage Action.

properties.name: TargetEncryptConnection
properties.help: Specifies if SQL encryption should be used for the target database connection. Default value is True.

properties.name: TargetHostNameInCertificate
properties.help: Specifies value that is used to validate the target SQL Server TLS/SSL certificate when the communication layer is encrypted by using TLS.

properties.name: TargetPassword
properties.help: For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the password to use to access the target database.

properties.name: TargetServerName
properties.help: Defines the name of the server hosting the target database.

properties.name: TargetTimeout
properties.help: Specifies the timeout for establishing a connection to the target database in seconds. For Azure AD, it is recommended that this value be greater than or equal to 30 seconds.

properties.name: TargetTrustServerCertificate
properties.help: Specifies whether to use TLS to encrypt the target database connection and bypass walking the certificate chain to validate trust. Default value is False.

properties.name: TargetUser
properties.help: For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the SQL Server user to use to access the target database.

properties.name: TenantId
properties.help:
Represents the Azure AD tenant ID or domain name. This option is required to support guest or imported Azure AD users as well as Microsoft accounts such as outlook.com, hotmail.com, or live.com. If this parameter is omitted, the default tenant ID for Azure AD will be used, assuming that the authenticated user is a native user for this AD. However, in this case any guest or imported users and/or Microsoft accounts hosted in this Azure AD are not supported and the operation will fail.
For more information about Active Directory Universal Authentication, see [Universal Authentication with SQL Database and Azure Synapse Analytics (SSMS support for MFA)](/azure/sql-database/sql-database-ssms-mfa-authentication).

properties.name: ThreadMaxStackSize
properties.help: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes for the thread running the SqlPackage action. This option should only be used when encountering stack overflow exceptions that occur when parsing very large TSQL statements.

properties.name: UniversalAuthentication
properties.help:
Specifies if Universal Authentication should be used. When set to True, the interactive authentication protocol is activated supporting MFA. This option can also be used for Azure AD authentication without MFA, using an interactive protocol requiring the user to enter their username and password or integrated authentication (Windows credentials). When /UniversalAuthentication is set to True, no Azure AD authentication can be specified in SourceConnectionString (/scs). When /UniversalAuthentication is set to False, Azure AD authentication must be specified in SourceConnectionString (/scs).
For more information about Active Directory Universal Authentication, see [Universal Authentication with SQL Database and Azure Synapse Analytics (SSMS support for MFA)](/azure/sql-database/sql-database-ssms-mfa-authentication).

tasks.help: The SqlPackage Export action exports a connected database to a BACPAC file (.bacpac). By default, data for all tables will be included in the .bacpac file. Optionally, you can specify only a subset of tables for which to export data. Validation for the Export action ensures Azure SQL Database compatibility for the complete targeted database even if a subset of tables is specified for the export.

properties.name: AccessToken
properties.help: Specifies the token-based authentication access token to use when connect to the target database.

properties.name: AzureCloudConfig
properties.help: Specifies the custom endpoints for connecting to Azure Active Directory in the format: AzureActiveDirectoryAuthority={value};DatabaseServicePrincipalName={value}" .

properties.name: Diagnostics
properties.help: Specifies whether diagnostic logging is output to the console. Defaults to False.

properties.name: DiagnosticsFile
properties.help: Specifies a file to store diagnostic logs.

properties.name: MaxParallelism
properties.help: Specifies the degree of parallelism for concurrent operations running against a database. The default value is 8.

properties.name: OverwriteFiles
properties.help: Specifies if SqlPackage should overwrite existing files. Specifying false causes SqlPackage to abort action if an existing file is encountered. Default value is True.

properties.name: Properties
properties.help: Specifies a name value pair for an [action-specific property](#properties-specific-to-the-export-action);{PropertyName}={Value}.

delegates.name: CommandTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the command timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQL Server.

delegates.name: CompressionOption
delegates.help: Specifies the type of compression.

delegates.name: DatabaseLockTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the database lock timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQLServer. Use -1 to wait indefinitely.

delegates.name: HashObjectNamesInLogs
delegates.help: Specifies whether to replace all object names in logs with a random hash value.

delegates.name: IgnoreIndexesStatisticsOnEnclaveEnabledColumns
delegates.help: Specifies whether indexes or statistics on columns encrypted using randomized encryption and enclave-enabled column encryption keys should be ignored (not included in the generated bacpac). By default (false) any index or a statistic on a column encrypted using randomized encryption and an enclave-enabled column encryption key will block the export action.

delegates.name: LongRunningCommandTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the long running command timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQL Server. Use 0 to wait indefinitely.

delegates.name: Storage
delegates.help: Specifies the type of backing storage for the schema model used during extraction. 'Memory' is default for .NET Core version of SqlPackage. 'File' is only available and default for .NET Framework version of SqlPackage.

delegates.name: TableData
delegates.help: Indicates the table from which data will be extracted. Specify the table name with or without the brackets surrounding the name parts in the following format: schema_name.table_identifier. This property may be specified multiple times to indicate multiple options.

delegates.name: TargetEngineVersion
delegates.help: This property is deprecated and use is not recommended. Specifies the version the target engine for Azure SQL Database is expected to be.

delegates.name: TempDirectoryForTableData
delegates.help: Specifies an alternative temporary directory used to buffer table data before being written to the package file. The space required in this location may be large and is relative to the full size of the database.

delegates.name: VerifyExtraction
delegates.help: Specifies whether the extracted schema model should be verified. If set to true, schema validation rules are run on the dacpac or bacpac.

delegates.name: VerifyFullTextDocumentTypesSupported
delegates.help: Specifies whether the supported full-text document types for Microsoft Azure SQL Database v12 should be verified.

properties.name: Quiet
properties.help: Specifies whether detailed feedback is suppressed. Defaults to False.

properties.name: SourceConnectionString
properties.help: Specifies a valid [SQL Server/Azure connection string](/dotnet/api/microsoft.data.sqlclient.sqlconnection.connectionstring) to the source database. If this parameter is specified, it shall be used exclusively of all other source parameters.

properties.name: SourceDatabaseName
properties.help: Defines the name of the source database.

properties.name: SourceEncryptConnection
properties.help: Specifies if SQL encryption should be used for the source database connection. Default value is True.

properties.name: SourceHostNameInCertificate
properties.help: Specifies value that is used to validate the source SQL Server TLS/SSL certificate when the communication layer is encrypted by using TLS.

properties.name: SourcePassword
properties.help: For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the password to use to access the source database.

properties.name: SourceServerName
properties.help: Defines the name of the server hosting the source database.

properties.name: SourceTimeout
properties.help: Specifies the timeout for establishing a connection to the source database in seconds.

properties.name: SourceTrustServerCertificate
properties.help: Specifies whether to use TLS to encrypt the source database connection and bypass walking the certificate chain to validate trust. Default value is False.

properties.name: SourceUser
properties.help: For SQL Server Auth scenarios, defines the SQL Server user to use to access the source database.

properties.name: TargetFile
properties.help: Specifies a target file (that is, a .dacpac file) to be used as the target of action instead of a database. If this parameter is used, no other target parameter shall be valid. This parameter shall be invalid for actions that only support database targets.

If this parameter is omitted, the default tenant ID for Azure AD will be used, assuming that the authenticated user is a native user for this AD. However, in this case any guest or imported users and/or Microsoft accounts hosted in this Azure AD are not supported and the operation will fail.

This option can also be used for Azure AD authentication without MFA, using an interactive protocol requiring the user to enter their username and password or integrated authentication (Windows credentials). When /UniversalAuthentication is set to True, no Azure AD authentication can be specified in SourceConnectionString (/scs). When /UniversalAuthentication is set to False, Azure AD authentication must be specified in SourceConnectionString (/scs).

tasks.help: The SqlPackage Extract action creates a schema of a connected database in a DACPAC file (.dacpac). By default, data is not included in the .dacpac file. To include data, utilize the Export action or use the Extract properties ExtractAllTableData/TableData.

properties.name: AccessToken
properties.help: Specifies the token based authentication access token to use when connect to the target database.

properties.name: AzureCloudConfig
properties.help: Specifies the custom endpoints for connecting to Azure Active Directory in the format: AzureActiveDirectoryAuthority={value};DatabaseServicePrincipalName={value}" .

properties.name: Diagnostics
properties.help: Specifies whether diagnostic logging is output to the console. Defaults to False.

properties.name: DiagnosticsFile
properties.help: Specifies a file to store diagnostic logs.

properties.name: MaxParallelism
properties.help: Specifies the degree of parallelism for concurrent operations running against a database. The default value is 8.

properties.name: OverwriteFiles
properties.help: Specifies if SqlPackage should overwrite existing files. Specifying false causes SqlPackage to abort action if an existing file is encountered. Default value is True.

properties.name: Properties
properties.help: Specifies a name value pair for an [action-specific property](#properties-specific-to-the-extract-action); {PropertyName}={Value}.

delegates.name: AzureStorageBlobEndpoint
delegates.help: Azure Blob Storage endpoint. See [SqlPackage for Azure Synapse Analytics](sqlpackage-for-azure-synapse-analytics.md#extract-export-data).

delegates.name: AzureStorageContainer
delegates.help: Azure Blob Storage container. See [SqlPackage for Azure Synapse Analytics](sqlpackage-for-azure-synapse-analytics.md#extract-export-data).

delegates.name: AzureStorageKey
delegates.help: Azure storage account key. See [SqlPackage for Azure Synapse Analytics](sqlpackage-for-azure-synapse-analytics.md#extract-export-data).

delegates.name: AzureStorageRootPath
delegates.help: Storage root path within the container. Without this property, the path defaults to `servername/databasename/timestamp/`. See [SqlPackage for Azure Synapse Analytics](sqlpackage-for-azure-synapse-analytics.md#extract-export-data).

delegates.name: CommandTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the command timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQL Server.

delegates.name: CompressionOption
delegates.help: Specifies the type of compression.

delegates.name: DacApplicationDescription
delegates.help: Defines the Application description to be stored in the DACPAC metadata.

delegates.name: DacApplicationName
delegates.help: Defined the Application name to be stored in the DACPAC metadata. The default value is the database name.

delegates.name: DacMajorVersion
delegates.help: Defines the major version to be stored in the DACPAC metadata.

delegates.name: DacMinorVersion
delegates.help: Defines the minor version to be stored in the DACPAC metadata.

delegates.name: DatabaseLockTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the database lock timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQLServer. Use -1 to wait indefinitely.

delegates.name: ExtractAllTableData
delegates.help: Indicates whether data from all user tables is extracted. If 'true', data from all user tables is extracted, and you cannot specify individual user tables for extracting data. If 'false', specify one or more user tables to extract data from.

delegates.name: ExtractApplicationScopedObjectsOnly
delegates.help: If true, only extract application-scoped objects for the specified source. If false, extract all objects for the specified source.

delegates.name: ExtractReferencedServerScopedElements
delegates.help: If true, extract login, server audit, and credential objects referenced by source database objects.

delegates.name: ExtractTarget
delegates.help: Specifies alternative output formats of the database schema, default is 'DacPac' to output a `.dacpac` single file. Additional options output one or more `.sql` files organized by either 'SchemaObjectType' (files in folders for each schema and object type), 'Schema' (files in folders for each schema), 'ObjectType' (files in folders for each object type), 'Flat' (all files in the same folder), or 'File' (1 single file).

delegates.name: ExtractUsageProperties
delegates.help: Specifies whether usage properties, such as table row count and index size, will be extracted from the database.

delegates.name: HashObjectNamesInLogs
delegates.help: Specifies whether to replace all object names in logs with a random hash value.

delegates.name: IgnoreExtendedProperties
delegates.help: Specifies whether extended properties should be ignored.

delegates.name: IgnorePermissions
delegates.help: Specifies whether permissions should be ignored.

delegates.name: IgnoreUserLoginMappings
delegates.help: Specifies whether relationships between users and logins are ignored.

delegates.name: LongRunningCommandTimeout
delegates.help: Specifies the long running command timeout in seconds when executing queries against SQL Server. Use 0 to wait indefinitely.

delegates.name: TempDirectoryForTableData
delegates.help: Specifies the temporary directory used to buffer table data before being written to the package file.

delegates.name: VerifyExtraction
delegates.help: Specifies whether the extracted schema model should be verified.
